justification: The article states that participants "sometimes described gamblers experiencing different levels of gambling-related harm in terms of the Problem Gambling Severity Index (PGSI; Ferris and Wynne 2001), a measurement of disordered gambling that is commonly used as a proxy for gambling-related harm".

When introducing the ‘correcting gambling misperceptions’ message type the authors note it was "based on research on gamblers' misperceptions (Raylu and Oei 2004)"; the cited work is titled "The gambling related cognitions scale (GRCS)", indicating that these cognitions are operationalised with the GRCS measure.
